response.answer_text: A Timeline is a sequence of events in chronological order from earliest (first) to the last. Timelines can be represented in graphical format (see fig 1) or textual format (see fig 2). Timelines are beneficial to those who wish to convey a series of events and how (or, if) they correlate to each other. Timelines have various applications in varying fields. In Law, for example, they can be instrumental in establishing chain of possession or an alibi for a crime. Whereas, in Film-making, it is oft employed to establish shooting and editing schedules.  fig. 1 - Graphical Timeline  fig 2. - Textual Timeline
Timeline means sequence of events in chronological order. A timeline is especially useful when you want to see at a glance when an event took place in relation to others important events.
